Description: Body sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (fired reddish and mostly lost); exterior: painted decoration consisting of griffin (part of head, neck, wing, front leg and body remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: The griffin on this sherd is unusual and may show influence from South Ionian workshops: compare the griffin on the South Ionian Middle I Wild Goat Style oinochoe, Richmond, VA 82.203 (Cook and Dupont 2003, 37, fig. 8.6).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0141) (phase 2)
